ConnectivityGridPINGFactory#

Module Contents#

Classes#

ConnectivityGridPINGFactory

This class determines the connectivity between neurons in the oscillatory network.
class ConnectivityGridPINGFactory.ConnectivityGridPINGFactory#

This class determines the connectivity between neurons in the oscillatory network.

create(self, params_ping: src.izhikevich_simulation.GridGeometryFactory.ParamsPING, params_connectivity: src.params.ParamsConnectivity.ParamsConnectivity, cortical_coords: list[list[tuple[float, float]]]) → src.izhikevich_simulation.Connectivity.Connectivity#

Determines the connectivity between neurons in the oscillatory network.

Parameters

  • params_ping (ParamsPING) – parameters describing PING networks and their composition.

  • params_connectivity (ParamsConnectivity) – parameters of the network connectivity.

  • cortical_coords (list[list[tuple[float, float]]]) – coordinates of the points in the visual cortex.

Returns

connectivity between neurons in the oscillatory network.

Return type

Connectivity

_compute_coupling_weights(self, params_ping: src.izhikevich_simulation.GridGeometryFactory.ParamsPING, params_connectivity: src.params.ParamsConnectivity.ParamsConnectivity, grid_geometry: src.izhikevich_simulation.GridGeometry.GridGeometry, cortical_coords: list[list[tuple[float, float]]]) → numpy.ndarray[int, int, float]#

Computes the coupling weights between all neurons.

Essentially, this method computes the full matrix \(K\) of coupling weights. The approach is derived from [Lowet et al., 2015].

Parameters

  • params_ping (ParamsPING) – parameters describing PING networks and their composition.

  • params_connectivity (ParamsConnectivity) – parameters of the network connectivity.

  • grid_geometry (GridGeometry) – contains information about grid locations of PING networks and neurons located in them.

  • cortical_coords (list[list[tuple[float, float]]]) – coordinates of the points in the visual cortex.

Returns

matrix of all coupling weights.

Return type

numpy.ndarray[(int, int), float]

_get_neurons_dist(self, neuron_type1: src.izhikevich_simulation.GridGeometry.NeuronTypes, neuron_type2: src.izhikevich_simulation.GridGeometry.NeuronTypes, nr1: int, nr2: int, grid_geometry: src.izhikevich_simulation.GridGeometry.GridGeometry, cortical_coords: list[list[tuple[float, float]]]) → numpy.ndarray[int, int, float]#

Computes the matrix of Euclidian distances between two types of neurons.

This method computes a matrix of \(\| \mathsf{loc}(v), \mathsf{loc}(w) \|\) between neurons \(v\) and \(w\) of given types.

Parameters

  • neuron_type1 (NeuronTypes) – neurons neuron_type 1

  • neuron_type2 (NeuronTypes) – neurons neuron_type 2

  • nr1 (int) – number of neurons of neuron_type 1

  • nr2 (int) – number of neurons of neuron_type 2

  • grid_geometry (GridGeometry) – contains information about grid locations of PING networks and neurons located in them.

  • cortical_coords (list[list[tuple[float, float]]]) – coordinates of the points in the visual cortex.

Returns

The matrix nr1 x nr2 of pairwise distances between neurons.

Return type

numpy.ndarray[(int, int), float]

_compute_type_coupling_weights(self, dist: numpy.ndarray[int, int, float], max_connect_strength: float, spatial_const: float) → numpy.ndarray[int, int, float]#

Computes the coupling weights for connections between two types of neurons.

This method computes a matrix of \(K_{v, w}\) between neurons \(v\) and \(w\) of given types.

Parameters

  • dist (numpy.ndarray[(int, int), float]) – distance matrix with pairwise distances between neurons.

  • max_connect_strength (float) – max connection strength between neuron types.

  • spatial_const (float) – spatial constant for the neuron types.

Returns

the matrix of coupling weights of size nr1 x nr2, where n1 and nr2 - number of neurons of each neuron_type in the coupling of interest.

Return type

numpy.ndarray[(int, int), float]
